availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles Anderson Dana (Washington, District of Columbia, Assistant Secretary of War (U.S.A))

body.p: Washington, District of Columbia, Assistant Secretary of War (U.S.A). Hinsdale, New Hampshire native. Son of Anderson Dana and Ann Dennison Dana. Married to Eunice MacDaneil on March 2, 1846 in New York City, New York. Father to Zoe Dana Underhill, Ruth Dana Draper, Paul Dana, Eunice Dana Brannan. Attended Harvard College from 1839 to 1841. Trustee and resident of utopian Brook Farm community from 1841 to 1846. Editor in New York City, New York in 1850. Editor of The New American Cyclopaedia in 1857. Journalist at New York Tribune from 1848 to 1862. Special investigating agent of the U.S. War Department from 1862 to 1864. Assistant Secretary of War from 1864 to 1865.

ab.bibl:
Amy Tikkanen, Charles A. Dana, in Encyclopedia Brittanica, October 13, 2018, (accessed May 2, 2019).
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, New York, New York, New York Ward 15 Eastern Half, p. 162A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, New York, New York, New York Ward 18 District 19 (2nd Enum), p. 577A
New York Evening Post, Marriages, March 20, 1846, (accessed via ancestry.com), pg 29.
